sense.name: an intentionally false statement
sense.examples: It is perjury to tell a lie under oath in a courtroom. The public now views everything the governor said as a pack of lies. She actually believed she'd seen John there, so her statement was not a lie.

sense.name: the orientation or position of an object
sense.examples: The golfer's ball had a good lie in relation to the putting green of the 16th hole. The stylist combed the woman's hair so the lie of the strands was puffed back and up.

sense.name: an ongoing situation of deceptive behavior
sense.commentary: LIE[+state][+social][+ongoing][+behavior][+deceptive] Note: is related to sense 1, but includes ongoing complexes of behavior and situations, not just verbal statements.
sense.examples: Bob came to the realization that he had been living a lie all through his marriage. Mary was soon to learn that the clique's apparent acceptance of her was really a lie.
